name: INTRO TO BIOENGINEERING

values.comments:
This is a survey course introducing students to the breadth of bioengineering. It consists of weekly guest lectures and a series of small projects and reports that allow students to explore different facets of bioengineering. MATLAB is a heavy component of this course, as well as a semester-long design project.

Most students did not feel that MATLAB was taught effectively and that what was required in the programming assignments was far more difficult than what was covered in class. Nonetheless, most recognized the importance of learning MATLAB. Several students felt that while the course provided decent exposure to bioengineering and its subdisciplines, it was not organized well and was a “waste of time” and “a train wreck.” Students generally found the guest lecturers to be “insightful,” but they could not fully enjoy them since they were required to complete three essay questions before the end of the class.

Many students described Professor Margulies as having the “ability to expose us to numerous fields within bioengineering” and “trying very hard to make the class successful.”

Students reported spending up to five hours on the MATLAB assignments, which were considered by many to be “frustrating” “busywork.” Several students recommended purchasing a MATLAB manual and downloading the software. The homework was described as “simply useless as no readings are tested and so no information need be absorbed.” This course is open to freshmen only and is directed toward students interested in majoring or minoring in Bioengineering. MATH 104 and PHYS 140/150 are co-requisites.
